title: 109_hr3924
content: The "Refinery Expansion Act of 2005" allows for 100 percent expensing or 5-year depreciation of costs for refinery property that increases refinery output by at least 5 percent. The "Refinery Expansion Act of 2005" allows for 100 percent expensing of qualified refinery property costs, with 50 percent expensing for other refinery property. The Refinery Expansion Act of 2005 allows for 100 percent expensing of qualified refinery property costs, with 50 percent expensing for other refinery property. The amendments made by this section allow for the deduction of costs paid or incurred by the taxpayer for refinery property eligible for expensing under section 179C(a)(2) but for the absence of an election under section 179C. These amendments are effective as if included in the Energy Policy Act of 2005. DEPRECIATION RECOVERY PERIOD FOR OIL AND GAS PIPELINES REDUCED TO 7 YEARS. The depreciation recovery period for oil and gas pipelines is reduced to 7 years, with specific conditions for qualifying distribution lines placed in service between April 11, 2005, and January 1, 2011. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code to reflect these changes. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code regarding the table in section 168(g)(3)(B) related to certain property classes. Item relating to subparagraph (E)(viii) is removed, and a new item is inserted after subparagraph (C)(vii). Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code regarding property classes are made, with changes to the table in section 168(g)(3)(B). A new item is inserted after subparagraph (C)(vii), and the amendments will take effect as if included in the Energy Policy Act of 2005. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include adding a new clause for a storage facility related to petroleum distribution, with specific conditions for eligibility. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after the enactment date, except for properties under binding contracts or already under construction before that date. Temporary suspension of depreciation recapture on Section 1245 refinery property. Temporary suspension of depreciation recapture on Section 1245 refinery property for upgrades made before January 1, 2012, to increase output, reduce pollution, or produce cleaner-burning fuel. The amendment made by this section applies to dispositions after the enactment date of this Act in taxable years ending after that date.
